intro: Atriplex wolfii, commonly known as saltbush, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in saline soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. The plant has small, scale-like leaves that reduce water loss, and it produces greenish-yellow flowers in clusters. It is often used in reclamation projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and tolerate high salinity. Atriplex wolfii plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
